name: Into the Chasm - Episode 2
tagline: in which the maze shifts, the dead speak, and the beast appears
shortSummary: The party pushes deeper into Zeyfa’s Labyrinth, surviving a warm crevasse and worsening storm, questioning a dead man from Melusa, and emerging into a black-stone chamber where a shaggy white beast appears.
longSummary: Drawn onward by the shifting geometry of Zeyfa’s Labyrinth, the party descends from the entrance chamber into tight, snowy tunnels of stone and hoarfrost, trying to keep their bearings as wind gusts swirl and passages fork unpredictably. In a low, ice-walled chamber split by a warm crevasse fringed with ice “ferns,” they test the depths with a lighted snowball, only to watch the light abruptly vanish, feel the wind and snow thicken, and struggle to get everyone across as Kalima pleads to turn back. Pressing forward, they find a human corpse pinned by ice and use Speak with Dead to learn of Melusa, a cliff-carved village that offers sacrifices to Zeyfa; the dead insists the labyrinth does not let anyone escape, while Finnan’s Memory of the Ancestors links Melusa to old stories of a waterfall shrine along the Teft tied to a kestavo called Melua. The storm worsens into whiteout as the maze rearranges itself around booming pulses and shadowy wind-creatures. Kalima is injured in the chaos, and after a collapse and an avalanche-like surge, the party slides down slick black ice into a quiet black-stone chamber—just in time for a towering shaggy white beast to answer Justas’s challenge.

npcs.name: Kalima
npcs.notes: Terrified woman from Melusa who names their prison Zeyfa’s Labyrinth; injured during the booming storm corridors and increasingly fearful of being carried by the kenku.

npcs.name: Rala
npcs.notes: Jrain’s avian companion used for scouting and situational help.

npcs.name: Unnamed man of Melusa
npcs.notes: Dead villager trapped in ice; questioned via Speak with Dead about Melusa, Zeyfa’s minion, and escape.

npcs.name: Zeyfa
npcs.notes: Cruel West Wind of Zimkovan/kestavo lore, said to rule the labyrinth and demand sacrifices.

npcs.name: Melua
npcs.notes: A kestavo associated (by Finnan’s remembered stories) with an old waterfall shrine on the upper Teft; possibly linguistically linked to Melusa.

npcs.name: Romil the Glacier King
npcs.notes: Name invoked in prayer and associated with the glacial light Kalima clutches.

npcs.name: Shaggy white beast
npcs.notes: A towering monster that emerges in the black-stone chamber as the session ends.

places.name: Zeyfa's Labyrinth
places.notes: The shifting ice-and-stone maze in which the party is trapped.

places.name: Great Chasm
places.notes: Referenced for comparison and lore; Ekko compares the labyrinth’s feel to the Chasm.

places.name: Teft
places.notes: River referenced in Finnan’s remembered stories connected to an old waterfall shrine and Melua.

places.name: Melusa
places.notes: Cliffside village named by the dead; described as carved into ice with a river running through it.

places.name: Crevasse room
places.notes: Low-ceilinged chamber split by a warm crack and fringed with ice “ferns.”

places.name: Black-stone chamber
places.notes: Stormless chamber reached by sliding down black ice; the white beast appears here.

places.name: Sentinel Range
places.notes: Referenced when comparing local stone to familiar mountain caves.

treasure: Plain silver ring worn on a necklace
